title: Ticket #5424: URL parser doesn't allow numbers
description:
If someone wants to write a filetransfer plugin for S3, s3:// doesn't get treated as a real URL by condor_submit.

TLMiller says: condor_utils/condor_url.cpp's IsUrl() forbids numbers in the urltype on line 30.
remarks:
2015-Dec-01 16:39:26 by tlmiller:
Just changing the isalpha() to isalnum() will avoid this particular problem (I imagine, needs to be tested), but whoever works on this should also look up the URI RFC and find out what else can be to the left of the colon.

They should also remove the buffer overflow from the next part of the function.

2015-Dec-01 16:50:36 by bcotton:
RFC 3986 says: 

  scheme      = ALPHA *( ALPHA / DIGIT / "+" / "-" / "." )
creator: bcotton
